alert.note: Alert for Montague (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued March 21 at 4:18PM CDT until March 21 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: The National Weather Service in Fort Worth has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Southern Montague County in north central Texas... * Until 500 PM CDT. * At 417 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Newport, or 15 miles southwest of Bowie, moving northeast at 50 mph. This storm has already produced a tornado in Jack County. HAZARD...Tornado and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Bowie and Sunset around 430 PM CDT. Stoneburg around 435 PM CDT. Nocona and St. Jo around 455 PM CDT. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Heavy rainfall may hide this tornado. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!
